column2: COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. All travellers over the age of 12 must present a negative COVID-19 test result when entering Aruba. The test can be either an antigen or a PCR test and must have been carried out no more than 24 hours before departure. As of 3 February 2022, travellers who completed their primary Covid-19 vaccination series and received a booster vaccination at least seven days before travelling, no longer need to provide a negative test result. The proof of the booster needs to be uploaded as part of the embarkation/disembarkation card process. This applies to travellers aged 18 and over.
column3: Self-isolation at own accommodation- subject to PCR. A health screening and temperature check will be carried out on arrival. Further information on testing and screening is available on the website of the Government of Aruba.
column5:
Latest News: Authorities lift all COVID-19-related entry requirements for all international travelers from 19 March (Travel Agent Central, 18.03.2022)

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Aruba: You must get approval to travel to Aruba through the embarkation/disembarkation card online before arrival. Visit the website of the Government of Aruba for the latest information on entry requirements.
*Testing/Screening on arrival: Travellers over the age of 12 must present a negative COVID-19 test result when entering Aruba. The test can be either an antigen or a PCR test and must have been carried out no more than 24 hours before departure. A health screening and temperature check will be carried out on arrival. Further information on testing and screening is available on the website of the Government of Aruba. As of 3 February 2022, travellers who completed their primary Covid-19 vaccination series and received a booster vaccination at least seven days before travelling, no longer need to provide a negative test result. The proof of the booster needs to be uploaded as part of the embarkation/disembarkation card process. This applies to travellers aged 18 and over.
The public health authorities of Aruba also advise you to download the Aruba Health App on your smart phone prior to your travel. This is to assist you and inform you about COVID-19 measures and instructions in Aruba. See the website of the Government of Aruba for more information about the Aruba Health App.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Aruba: The Government of Aruba has put measures in place in response to the coronavirus pandemic. such as the mandatory wearing of face masks in all public indoor spaces. All measures and updates can be found on thewebsite of the government of Aruba .
